events.name: Virtual Reality (VR) & Internet of things (IoT) Hackathon

venue.name: BUNI Innovation Hub
venue.address_1: Tanzania Commission for Science and Technology, Science Junction - Kijitonyama

events.description:
The Virtual Reality (VR) & Internet of things (IoT) Hackathon is an international event that brings together developers, designers, innovators, thinkers, hackers, and implementers to solve problems in Africa. The event involves software development, graphic design, hardware development, program innovation, etc. to develop solutions, with the aim of tackling a proposed challenge.

The proposed solutions will be the ones that involves the use of Virtual Reality (VR) technologies and Internet of Things (IoT) technologies.

The hackathon is hosted by Sahara Sparks in collaboration with Solve.studio, GDG Dar es Salaam and GDG Mwanza.

Prior knowledge about Virtual reality and Internet of things is of value but not a requirement.

Here is the registration link Registration

events.name: GDG DevFest 2017

venue.name: BUNI Innovation Hub
venue.address_1: Tanzania Commission for Science and Technology, Science Junction - Kijitonyama

events.description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

AGENDA:
9:00 AM Arrival & Registration
9:30 AM Event opening/ introductions

TechTalks and Keynotes
9:45 AM Google i/o highlights
10:15 AM Android Tech talk
10:30 AM Introducing Google Women Tech Maker

30 Minutes Tea Break

11:00 AM Demo and Products showcasing (Google assistant,...) - To Be Comfirmed

Code Labs
Code lab on: 

Firebase analytics (Web & Android)

Firebase messaging (Android)

Getting started with AngularJS

1:30 PM Lunch Break

Code Labs
3:00 PM Understanding Progressive Web apps
3:30 PM Progressive Web Apps Hands on Session

4:20 PM Closing and remarks

You can confirm your attendance by registering via this link  or by confirming on Meetup if you are meetup user
events.how_to_find_us: Buni Hub is located at Sayansi -Kijitonyama, COSTECH Bulding, Ground Floor, left wing

events.name: Mobile Sites Certification Study Jam

venue.name: BUNI Innovation Hub
venue.address_1: Tanzania Commission for Science and Technology, Science Junction - Kijitonyama

events.description:
GDG Dar is organising a study jam on mobile site certification. This is a chance to get a professional accreditation that demonstrates you have an understanding of basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. By learning together we think it’s going to be more fun and more of us are going to be able to complete it.

Requirements

You need basic web development skills to take part and it typically it takes 3-4 hours to run through the course materials, followed by a 90 minute multiple choice exam. It’s possible to do it entirely online alone, but we’d like to run through it together as a group.

Why do it?

There is more traffic to mobile sites than desktop yet most sites don’t provide an effective experience for users. Best practice is changing rapidly so what people may have learned a few years ago may not be up to date. For companies and site owners we see better mobile design leading to significant and measurable improvements in customer acquisition, retention and engagement (https://developers.google.com/web/showcase/).

Sounds great, where do I sign up?

Reserve your ticket now and lets wait for the big jamming day...!!

events.description: We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Dar es Salaam

venue.name: BUNI Innovation Hub
venue.address_1: Tanzania Commission for Science and Technology, Science Junction - Kijitonyama

events.description: Google IO Extended Dar es Salaam is an annual developer's conference organized to learn about Google’s latest development and products in our community.. It is an event where local developers get to connect with the keynote and sessions of Google IO 2018.

events.name: Build Action for Google Assistant & Machine Learning

venue.name: BUNI Innovation Hub
venue.address_1: Tanzania Commission for Science and Technology, Science Junction - Kijitonyama

events.description:
Actions on Google is a developer platform that lets you create software to extend the functionality of the Google Assistant, Google’s virtual personal assistant, across more than 500 million devices, including smart speakers, phones, cars, TVs, headphones, watches, and more.

Users engage Google Assistant in conversation to get things done, like buying groceries or booking a ride (for a complete list of what’s possible now, see the Actions directory.) As a developer, you can use Actions on Google to easily create and manage delightful and effective conversational experiences between users and your own 3rd-party fulfillment service.

For the Machine Learning part,its a continuation of how to integrate ML kit with fire base in our apps...
See you there.....!!!

events.name: Flutter Study Jam

venue.name: BUNI Innovation Hub
venue.address_1: Tanzania Commission for Science and Technology, Science Junction - Kijitonyama

events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

NB:For those who attended the previous meetup,we conduct a live demo of a local Google Assistant app without forgetting the Q&A session.

events.name: Google Cloud Next '18 Extended - Daar es Salaam

venue.name: BUNI Innovation Hub
venue.address_1: Tanzania Commission for Science and Technology, Science Junction - Kijitonyama

events.description:
Join us for this year's Next Extended event, where we'll bring together cloud enthusiasts and the developer community to be a part of the Next '18 experience.

This year, we will be diving deep into cloud with technical keynotes, a hands-on TOPIC (Kubernetes, ML, or Google Cloud Certification) lab, and local speakers.

As an attendee, you'll not only be a part of our vibrant cloud community but also receive free access to Qwiklabs (a $55+ value)!

Don't forget to bring a laptop (PC, Mac, or Chromebook), and get ready for the best Next Extended yet!

Make sure to RSVP to receive upcoming information about this event, and visit https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/ to learn more about Google Cloud Next '18.

events.name: Digital trends in Tanzania - The e-commerce revolution

venue.name: BUNI Innovation Hub
venue.address_1: Tanzania Commission for Science and Technology, Science Junction - Kijitonyama

events.description:
Buni Hub in collaboration with Pesapal and GDG Dar es salaam brings to you a breakfast session on the digital trends in Tanzania zooming on the e-commerce revolution.

The event will be facilitated by John Mwongela the CEO of Pesapal one of Africas leading digital payment gateways. More about Pesapal visit https://www.pesapal.com/tz/
